topic.title: Feature request: blacklisting a zite
topic.body:
Currently there's no way to distinguish between "I have never visited this zite, so I don't know whether it's worth visiting/seeding" and "I have visited this zite, decided it's not worth seeding, and deleted it". This creates the strange situation that I potentially spend more bandwidth downloading zites I don't like than those I do.

It'd be nice to be able to flag a zite as the latter category, so that if I later click a link to it, instead of redownloading, I get a popup or a placeholder page saying something like "You have blacklisted this zite. Download anyway?".

1_17To4zKQntCiVqSZqHK3mwEpbLWVCtLHEe.body: Standard bittorrent already supports trackerless torrents, doesn't it? Surely it must be possible to integrate this into Zeronet.

2_162gsjqc5VB9ijkvSZMZVrcqdmqQ7XugiF.body: @satandroid It'd be nice to be able to offline Zeronet while still using networking for everything else.

1_19dfuqqdasCxD56Yn8KGcgcckbdkV9SZi4.body: This strikes me as scope creep. If you want Freenet, use Freenet; don't reimplement it in Zeronet. If you want privacy in Zeronet, use Tor and disk encryption.

8_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body: [The FAQ says](/17Kom2G5qNDc6NaQwv445h1gFzxkY3ZtZe/faq/#is-there-anyway-to-track-the-bandwidth-zeronet-is-using) I can track data usage from the sidebar, but the report there seems to be per zite. Is there a way to track _overall_ data usage for Zeronet as a whole?
